Bulletins.BulletinTitle: Vehicle reservations for the winter season opened Oct 28 at 10am
Bulletins.BulletinText:
Vehicle reservations for the winter 2025 schedule were released on Tuesday, Oct. 28. Reservations are now open for booking through March 21, 2026. 

Anacortes/San Juan Islands only:  

  • The two-week and two-day reservation releases will remain at 7 a.m.
  • We’ve added service this winter, and the sailing schedule is now the same schedule as the fall and spring sailing seasons.

Bulletins.BulletinTitle: Sea/BI - Walla Walla to replace Kaleetan this afternoon
Bulletins.BulletinText: This afternoon, the 188-vehicle Walla Walla will replace the 144-vehicle Kaleetan to restore some vehicle capacity on the route. We do not expect service impacts during this vessel swap. Thank you for your patience as we maintain, repair, and inspect our vessels.

Bulletins.BulletinTitle: Sea/Brem - Kaleetan to replace Walla Walla this afternoon
Bulletins.BulletinText: This afternoon, the 144-vehicle Kaleetan will replace the 188-vehicle Walla Walla. We know vehicle capacity reductions can be frustrating and lead to longer wait times. This boat move is based on route ridership and vessel capacity while we are limited on vessels due to repairs. Thank you for your patience as we maintain, repair, and inspect our vessels.

Bulletins.BulletinTitle: Sea/Brem - Changes to Seattle/Bremerton Route Schedule This Winter
Bulletins.BulletinText:
For our upcoming winter sailing season starting Dec. 28, there will be changes to the Seattle/Bremerton route schedule due to construction. While we're replacing two in-water terminal structures at Bremerton in January, we cannot tie up two boats there overnight. The route’s #1 boat will dock in Seattle during this work. 

Winter schedule changes from Dec. 28, 2025 through March 21, 2026: 

  • No 4:50 a.m. Bremerton departure (early morning commuters can take the Kitsap Fast Ferry’s 4:40 a.m. sailing). 
  • The 3:00 p.m. out of Bremerton will leave at 2:40 p.m. 
  • Added 10:15 p.m. Bremerton to Seattle sailing. 
  • On Sundays, the 8:35 a.m. Seattle and 9:50 a.m. Bremerton departures are canceled for refueling (normally done overnight in Bremerton). 

 We will send additional reminders about these schedule changes, including when they are live on the schedule webpage.

Bulletins.BulletinTitle: Muk/Clin -Update on Mukilteo/Clinton route weekday cancellations early next year
Bulletins.BulletinText:
We now have a rough timeline for construction work that will affect our Mukilteo/Clinton route early next year. The nine weekdays of midday sailing cancellations will likely occur during the first two full weeks of January and the first two full weeks of February. We plan to share the specific closure dates in November once they are finalized with the contractor.  

What to expect in early 2026 during terminal construction 

Each of the nine weekday closures will be about 4 hours long. These cancellations are planned outside of the busiest commute times. 

  • The last morning sailings will be the 8:30 a.m. out of Clinton and the 9 a.m. out of Mukilteo.
  • Service will resume with the 1 p.m. Clinton departure and 1:30 p.m. Mukilteo departure. 

    On the night prior to the nine weekdays, the route’s final roundtrip will be cancelled so crews can set up for the next day’s work. 

    • The final sailings on the nights before weekday closures will be the 11:30 p.m. Clinton departure and the 12:15 a.m. Mukilteo departure, which will be 10 minutes later than the normal 12:05 a.m. departure. 

    About this construction 

    We'll make repairs at our Mukilteo ferry terminal to the left (west) wing wall, which helps guide the ferry in place during landings. This wing wall was damaged and moved out of position during a hard ferry landing in 2022. We made initial repairs after the incident, but this important and required work will provide a more solid structure for ferry captains as they land vessels in Mukilteo. 

    We’ll keep you updated on this project through rider alerts, the WSF Weekly email, and social media. You can also sign up for a project-specific email list for more frequent updates.

Bulletins.BulletinTitle: Muk/Clin - ADA Alert - Tokitae #2 elevator is out of service
Bulletins.BulletinText: The #2 elevator on the Tokitae is out of service.  The #1 elevator is available for customer use.

Bulletins.BulletinTitle: PT/Coup - Tidal Cancellations for Tuesday, November 4
Bulletins.BulletinText:
Low tides will cancel one or more sailings from Port Townsend and Coupeville in November. Please see our Tidal Cancellations table for a complete list of affected dates and departures.

On Tuesday,  November 4, the 5:15 p.m. & 6:45 p.m. sailing from Port Townsend and 6:00 p.m. & 7:30 p.m. from Coupeville are cancelled due to tidal conditions.

Your alternate routes are Edmonds/Kingston and/or Mukilteo/Clinton

Edmonds / Kingston Schedule 

Mukilteo / Clinton Schedule

Bulletins.BulletinTitle: Vehicle reservations for the winter season opened Oct 28 at 10am
Bulletins.BulletinText:
Vehicle reservations for the winter 2025 schedule were released on Tuesday, Oct. 28. Reservations are now open for booking through March 21, 2026. 

Anacortes/San Juan Islands only:  

  • The two-week and two-day reservation releases will remain at 7 a.m.
  • We’ve added service this winter, and the sailing schedule is now the same schedule as the fall and spring sailing seasons.

Bulletins.BulletinTitle: Edm/King - SR 104 Weekday Roadwork Delays in Kingston
Bulletins.BulletinText:
Plan for possible weekday travel delays on State Route 104 near our Kingston terminal this fall. Work begins next week on a Kitsap County ferry traffic lane project. Crews are installing a stoplight system at Lindvog Road Northeast that detects when there is space for vehicles in the ferry line to proceed forward. They will also add kiosks that dispense boarding passes to help manage ferry traffic.  

What to expect: From 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Tuesdays through Fridays, expect alternating one-way traffic in this area. There will also be occasional full traffic stops in both directions approaching the work zone. Crews are scheduled to wrap up by winter.  

The stop light and boarding pass system is planned to start this winter. We will keep you updated through rider alerts on timing and how the system will work.

Bulletins.BulletinTitle: Muk/Clin - ADA Alert - Tokitae #2 elevator is out of service
Bulletins.BulletinText: The #2 elevator on the Tokitae is out of service.  The #1 elevator is available for customer use.

Bulletins.BulletinTitle: Faunt/Va/SW - Route To Operate on 2-Boat Alternate Schedule Until Further Notice
Bulletins.BulletinText:
The Fauntleroy/Vashon/Southworth route will operate a two-boat alternate schedule until further notice.

  • 2-boat Fauntleroy/Vashon
  • 2-boat Southworth/Vashon
  • 2-boat Fauntleroy/Southworth 

Updates will occur when more information is available.
